page.title: 15ASHFORD PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: Ashford in the Water Parish Coucil was formed in 1930 previously called a parish meeting. Sheldon had a parish meeting until 1920 when there was an official "grouping"of the two parishes the council has six elected reps from Ashford in the Water and one from Sheldon.In 19 land known as the 'Hall Orchard'was bought by the P.C.for rec_ reational use as there was the fear it would be bought for building.Funds were raised from the Playing Fields Ass.and events in the village.Part was given to the W.Derbys.District Council for building public toilets.Ajoining land was provided for a Parish Burial Ground in 19 (extended in 19 ).Allot_ ments still exist,but some land was sold to buy the rec.ground.The P.C.is responsible for appointing trustees to administer 3 charities.
